reviews.title: Excellent stay at Arden Way
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from a two night new year break at Arden Way Guest House and we had such a lovely relaxing time. Our room was comfortable, warm and quiet with a very clean en-suite/shower. The room was cleaned and towels were changed daily and the breakfast was great – full English with bacon, egg, sausages, fried bread, tomatoes and mushrooms plus tea/coffee, fruit juice, cereals, fresh fruit salad and yoghurts – perfect for starting the day.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Jeanne is a wonderful host and was very welcoming even when we arrived early before she had chance to make up our room. We were allowed to leave our car in the car park outside the house before we checked in and after we had finished our final day in Stratford.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: The guest house is about 5 minutes walk to the riverside/recreation ground and 10 minutes into Stratford town centre for all the attractions. There are some nice walks in the immediate area around the park and riverside and the area is quiet and safe.

reviews.title: Cosy and comfortable!
reviews.text: Overall, a fabulous break and we would definitely recommend Arden Way.

reviews.title: Good location, high standard rooms, flexible owner
reviews.text: Very good quality clean room combined with a good breakfast made this an excellent choice for my recent visit to Stratford. Being close to the theatre and the town centre is an added bonus and I think this B and B offers very good value.

reviews.title: Fabulous birthday weekend!
reviews.text: Great location, lovely room, super breakfast.

reviews.title: the hills Birthday treat
reviews.text: Actually stayed in August 2011 but forgot to write review at the time and have just been desperately searching for the name of the guest house as planning to go to Stratford in November and wanted to stay there again! So glad to have found it.

reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, first class
reviews.text: It was our first time at Arden way guest house and it was brilliant we were in stratford for 2 nights the first night stayed at Alveston manor 2nd night Arden way wish we had stayed at Arden way both nights we can highly recommend this guest house it was amazingly clean and comfortable very friendly excellent breakfast and free parking we will be using it again dont bother with alveston manor its not worth the money go to Arden way guest house you wont be disappointed good location for the town as well.

reviews.title: Very friendly & excellent value for money
reviews.text: Clean, comfortable, light and airy, Jeanne is a great host and pays great attention to detail, excellent breakfast lovely and beautifully presented. This B&B is 5 minutes walk from the centre of Stratford and can recommend the lovely Thai Boathouse restaurant by the river.

reviews.title: Very confortable and lovely reception
reviews.text: Really friendly owner, very knowledgeable about RSC theatres and productions. The house is well situated for the theatres and attractions being just over the bridge from the RST. Immaculate room and good breakfast.

reviews.title: Just right!
reviews.text: Great location - 5 minutes to town by the river. Lovely lady, helpful and friendly. Great breakfast, spotlessly clean room. Parking just outside, just leave the car and walk. Nice town to shop or eat out in.

reviews.title: Wonderful location and excellent quality
reviews.text: This guesthouse will not disappoint. The breakfast was delicious, the service friendly and the location is absolutely perfect for all of the best parts of Stratford-upon-avon. Very highly recommended.

reviews.title: Fab guest house
reviews.text: After reading reviews on trip advisor we decided to stay at Arden way guest house and we were not disappointed. We were greeted warmly by Jeanne and shown to our clean, comfortable and spacious double guest room. The b & b is located a short walk from the town centre and parking at the b &b was good. After a good nights sleep in a comfortable bed we enjoyed a generously portioned, delicious breakfast. We really enjoyed our stay and would definately recommend Arden Way Guesthouse.

reviews.title: Wonderful B&B
reviews.text: Being an American & driving a manual on the "wrong side", arriving at the Arden Way Guesthouse in a downpour, I was very thankful it was easy to find and there was no problem parking. We arrived earlier than planned, a note was on the door that they were out for a moment. It was no problem though, we left the car and walked easily into town. When we returned we were greeted warmly and LOVED our super clean and comfortable room. Breakfast was wonderful and the hosts very helpful with directions for our next location. A perfect place to stay if in Stratford and I hope to come back some day!

reviews.title: Consistent high standard year to year
reviews.text: We chose to return here after our first visit last year, and it was again, an excellent choice. The proprieter is a lovely, welcoming person who maintains spotless bedrooms, and serves a very generous and well cooked breakfast in a guest house which is in easy walking distance of the theatre and town. When we return to Stratford next year, this will be our first choice accomodation, and would recommend it highly. Why can't all other places be like this?

reviews.title: Immaculate and welcoming
reviews.text: I normally don't stay in B&Bs, I don't know why..just normally go for the ease of a hotel with everything on my doorstep.

reviews.title: Fantastic stay
reviews.text: Arden Way has completely confused me now! The standard of accommodation/ facilities and service is impeccable and when you consider the cost I would go as far to say, they are possibly under valuing themselves.

reviews.title: Best B&B In Stratford
reviews.text: There is free parking at the front with enough space for about 6 cars( it has 6 rooms). The owner, Jeanne is just amazing. She offers a really warm welcome with a great explanation of everything both inside and outside of the hotel. Rooms are spotlessly clean with comfy beds,soft fluffy towels and crisp bed linen. Tea/ coffee is provided as is digital free view and FREE wifi. I stayed in one of the rooms overlooking the rear garden,( again immaculately kept- not sure if guests can use?), lovely and quiet- slept like a log.

reviews.title: lovely!!!
reviews.text: Breakfast normally starts at 8.15 but this host will do everything to accommodate even the most difficult of people- me! She rose early to cook my breakfast with an added bonus of Fried bread. The breakfast room is bright and as you would expect presented to a high standard.

reviews.title: Arden Way is very good value
reviews.text: It's probably about 10 minutes walk into town across the bridge but within coughing distance is an excellent pub/ bistro.
